title: Bo Diddley
summary: Ellas McDaniel (born Ellas Otha Bates;[1] December 30, 1928 â€“ June 2, 2008), known as Bo Diddley, was an American singer, guitarist, songwriter and music producer who played a key role in the transition from the blues to rock and roll. He influenced many artists, including Buddy Holly,[2] Elvis Presley,[3] the Beatles, the Rolling Stones,[4] the Animals, George Thorogood, and the Clash.[5]
